Part 3:

1. My decoder creates the file "part1_text.txt", and shows the entire Shelock Holmes text.

2. I calculate the probabilities of each symbol in part3.java. The results can be seen below, in the order of: symbol, count, probability

3. The theoretical entropy: 4.477367118971064

4. The compressed entropy in the provided file: 4.832804878265648

5. My encoder re-encoded the raw English text into "recompressed.dat"

6. The compressed entropy in the new recompressed file: 4.516878848934168

7. Since the compressed entory acheived by the new recompressed file is slightly lower than that of the provided file (and closer to the 
theoretical entropy), my encoder achieves better compression than the original compressed file.
